intro: Sorindeia madagascariensis f. heterantha, commonly known as the Madagascar sorindeia, is a unique flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, asymmetrical flowers that are often pale yellow or greenish-white. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and small, clustered fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
